oai_dc:dc.dc:description: /kú–te–!gaúä, who could enter fire unharmed, enables the Mantis to do the same. The ingratitude of the latter to his instructor again brings him into trouble; and his newly acquired power deserts him. (L VIII.
te !gaua goes through fire and draws out cats, 'such cat's as had no equal in beauty' and then skins them. |kaggen (the Mantis) sings like |ku
te !gaua and also gets skins, but he refuses to share them with |ku
te !gaua angrily says that |kaggen and the skins will burn in the fire, which happens.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: |ku
te
!gaua and |kaggen
